We don't feel Draven's bleed passive was good for the game so reintroducing it's not something we'd want to test. Draven's current passive isn't perfect, but it does shift some of his power to later in the game, provides some strong highs/lows depending on when he can/can't cash in and fits pretty well with Draven's showman nature. His old passive by contrast made him both more of an early bully and made it harder to appreciate his exact damage output. Certainly sad about the loss of the blood brothers connection with Darius, we felt that was a case where gameplay had to take priority over thematics though.

As a side note we're not seeing any drastic drops in Draven's perfomance. Statistics aren't everything of course, looking at them though he's pretty much exactly average in win rate for experienced players, at both high and low elo.

Some passives, such as Zilean's and Draven's, will stop contributing if a game goes long enough. Few games get to level 18 or 6 items though, so we feel that's an acceptable cost that's more than outweighed by the extra design space that interactions with gold and XP allow.

In terms of snowball a passive that offers future gold, with some requirements to get it, is significantly less snowbally than simply starting with substantially higher raw power from level 1 in lane.

Dependence on kill does have some downsides, both in terms of player satisfaction/expectations of kill ownership and team interaction. It does give some great game to game variance though and allows for some positive teamplay moments as well, particularly since putting kills onto a marksman is usually the correct play regardless.

What about Syndra's passive? It literally only applies at 4 levels (9,13,16,18) and it doesn't even do that much for her considering her win rate drops off pretty hard as game duration increases. She hasn't been a very good pick since her Q was nerfed by 20 damage at rank 1 and she has problems as an immobile mage; will she be seeing any changes/buffs in the upcoming update?

> If I remember correctly the reasoning behind removing old passive was to reduce his snowballing but then RIOT added a PURELY snowballing passive.

The reasoning was to lower his early game power. The snowballing was secondary to that problem. He was snowballing because he was just stronger than everyone else early game, and that was the core issue. The new passive doesn't make him stronger than everyone else early game just by default. It gives him a reward if he's doing well, and that can start a snowball, but he actually has to do something in order to be stronger than other champions. That's way better than snowballing because you're just stronger right out of the gate.

>except at 6 Item lategame you literally DONT HAVE A PASSIVE.

Honestly, I don't care. Very few games make it to 6 items, a small percentage of those spend a significant amount of time at 6 items, and even then he's still stronger at 6 items than plenty of other champions are. I don't really care if a passive stops functioning in the very end of a very small portion of my games.

>What about game modes where gold wont matter?

What about them? Even in  ARAM he does perfectly fine, and that's about as much of a gold-guaranteed mode as the game has ever had. Again, I'm not seeing a real problem. If he's still preforming at a perfectly acceptable level there, then what's wrong?

My problem with Draven this season is mostly the item changes.
Draven is one of the few champions with no AP scaling, yet incredible AD scaling, and only mediocre usefulness off AS (W) but across the board AD items have been nerfed and AS items buffed.
Crit is now a larger factor but tied with the AS items and overall AD nerf, it turns into a net nerf for Draven.

> Draven
> BASE ATTACK DAMAGE 50.38 ⇒ 55.8
> ATTACK DAMAGE GROWTH STAT 3.5 ⇒ 2.91

In regards to scaling, Draven is an early game monster and lane bully, who relies on his (current) snowball passive to outscale his opponents.
Or rather he used to be, the 5.42 increased starting AD but overall decreased starting AD (mastery changes) and decreased AD per level means he's losing his early game advantage required for his passive, the changes to penetration and items overall means he can't snowball as hard to compensate and therefore almost every other adc outscale him between level 6-13.

> Draven
> BASE MANA 310.56 ⇒ 360.56
> MANA GROWTH STAT 42 ⇒ 39
> (No regen changes)

Mana is also a problem, and even as a superb juggler the cost on W is just too high, when used in sucession he risk running out immediately. (Making plays)
If I drop one axe the added mana is now spent.
I would increase his base mana regen now that there are no more blue pots, and I have to make bigger flashier plays to achieve the same level of performance that I did last season.
It would also be nice if some of the mana cost was refunded when you have 2 axes spinning and catch an additional axe or activate Q again.
Or to let it run on an ammo count, with a 6 sec cd, so rather than dropping both axes once the 6 seconds are up, he'll only lose one.

I would argue that Draven is in a far worse position now and the decreased animation and missile speed is only a fraction of the problems he's facing.
